block.p: Pentacon, the former East German camera maker that was considered an industrial pearl of the Communist state, will become a retraining center for its 6,000 unemployed workers, German officials said Friday. "Pentacon couldn't have made it in the free market with the best will in the world," said Alexander Koch, a board member at the Treuhandanstalt privatization agency. Pentacon, based in Dresden, once held 10 percent of the world camera market, but it became a huge money loser after July 1, when German monetary union stripped away its subsidies and converted costs into hard currency.
